page.title: 15ROTHAMSTEAD FARM
page.content: This farm belongs to the Rothamstead Experimental Station and is used for experiments as well as commercial farming. It is mainly used for crop experiments and in our section of the farm our experiments with fertilizers and pesticides. The farm has its own bore hole in the chalk aquifer and uses the water for irrigation. The main laboratories and farm buildings are found outside our section as are the original experiments by John Bennet Lawes the founder of the research station in the mid nineteenth century.
